**Tender for Technical Writing Services (Rédacteur technique et de l’énoncé des besoins)**

**Contracting Entity:** Natural Resources Canada
**Contracting Authority:** Danielle Chiasson
**Contract Number:** NRCan-5000072640
**Description of the Contract:** The contract will be for technical writing services to provide building science advisory support, develop procedures, perform research, conducting testing, editing, and creating technical documentation.
**Estimated Level of Effort:** The estimated duration is approximately 240 days.
**Contract Period:** The contract will be from the date of award to April 30, 2024.
**Extension Options:** The contract has four one-year irrevocable options for extension, allowing Natural Resources Canada to extend the contract term.
**Notice Type:** This is a Request for Proposal (Demande de propositions).
**Method of Supply:** The Task and Solutions Professional Services (TSPS) Method of Supply will be used.
**Supply Arrangement (SA) Holders:** The following SA Holders have been invited to submit a proposal:
  1. 8513929 Canada Inc
  2. Altis Human Resources (Ottawa) Inc.
  3. Altis Human Resources (Ottawa) Inc., Excel Human Resources Inc., and Altis Human Resources Inc. (In Joint Venture)
  4. 4336615 Canada Inc. and RFP Solutions Inc. (Joint Venture)
  5. Acosys Consulting Services Inc.
  6. Adirondack Information Management Inc.
  7. ADRM Technology Consulting Group Corp.
  8. ADRM Technology Consulting Group Corp. and Randstad Interim Inc.
  9. Altis Human Resources (Ottawa) Inc.
  10. ARTEMP PERSONNEL SERVICES INC
  ...
  40. Transpolar Technology Corporation and The Halifax Computer Consulting Group (In Joint Venture)
**Security Requirements:** Before awarding the contract, the contractor/male contractor must hold a valid designated organization screening (BOD) issued by the Contract Security Program (CSP) of the Public Works and Government Services Canada (TPSGC) and ensure their personnel comply with security restrictions.
**Trade Agreements:** The contract is subject to the provisions of several Trade Agreements including the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP) and the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).

Note: Only Canadian contractors
